int.name: rectangular
int.description: Cylindrical R,Z ala eqdsk. In this case the position arrays should not be filled since they are redundant with grid/dim1 and dim2.

int.name: inverse
int.description: Rhopolar_polar 2D polar coordinates (rho, theta) with magnetic axis as center of grid; theta and values following the COCOS convention, theta=atan2(z-zaxis,r-raxis)â‰¡polar angle

int.name: inverse_psi_straight_field_line
int.description: Flux surface type with psi as radial label, theta straight-field line (mod(index,10)=1), could be non-equidistant; magnetic axis as center of grid; following the COCOS convention

int.name: inverse_psi_equal
int.description: Arc flux surface type with psi as radial label, theta to have equal arc (mod(index,10)=2)

int.name: inverse_psi_polar
int.description: Flux surface type with psi as radial label, theta as polar angle, could be non-equidistant

int.name: inverse_psi_m
int.description: Flux surface type with psi as radial label and poloidal mode number as dim2, could be non-equidistant

int.name: inverse_rhopolnorm_straight field line
int.description: Flux surface type with radial label is sqrt[(psi-psi_axis)/(psi_edge-psi_axis)] and theta straight-field line

int.name: inverse_rhopolnorm_equal arc
int.description: Flux surface type with radial label is sqrt[(psi-psi_axis)/(psi_edge-psi_axis)], theta to have equal arc

int.name: inverse_rhopolnorm_polar
int.description: Same as 13 but radial label is sqrt[(psi-psi_axis)/(psi_edge-psi_axis)], theta as polar angle, could be non-equidistant

int.name: inverse_rhopolnorm_m
int.description: Same as 13 but radial label is sqrt[(psi-psi_axis)/(psi_edge-psi_axis)] and poloidal mode number as dim2, could be non-equidistant

int.name: inverse_rhotornorm_straight field line
int.description: Flux surface type with radial label is sqrt[Phi/Phi_edge], Phi being toroidal flux and theta straight-field line

int.name: inverse_rhotornorm_equal arc
int.description: Flux surface type with radial label is sqrt[Phi/Phi_edge], Phi being toroidal flux, theta to have equal arc

int.name: inverse_rhotornorm_polar
int.description: Flux surface type with radial label is sqrt[Phi/Phi_edge], Phi being toroidal flux, theta as polar angle, could be non-equidistant

int.name: inverse_rhotornorm_m
int.description: Flux surface type with radial label is sqrt[Phi/Phi_edge], Phi being toroidal flux, poloidal mode number as dim2, could be non-equidistant

int.name: inverse_rhopol_straight field line
int.description: Flux surface type with radial label is sqrt[psi-psi_axis] and theta straight-field line

int.name: inverse_rhopol_equal arc
int.description: Flux surface type with radial label is sqrt[psi-psi_axis], theta to have equal arc

int.name: inverse_rhopol_polar
int.description: Same as 13 but radial label is sqrt[psi-psi_axis], theta as polar angle, could be non-equidistant

int.name: inverse_rhopol_m
int.description: Same as 13 but radial label is sqrt[psi-psi_axis], poloidal mode number as dim2, could be non-equidistant

int.name: inverse_rhotor_straight field line
int.description: Flux surface type with radial label is sqrt[Phi/pi/B0], Phi being toroidal flux and theta straight-field line

int.name: inverse_rhotor_equal arc
int.description: Flux surface type with radial label is sqrt[Phi/pi/B0], Phi being toroidal flux, theta to have equal arc

int.name: inverse_rhotor_polar
int.description: Flux surface type with radial label is sqrt[Phi/pi/B0], Phi being toroidal flux, theta as polar angle, could be non-equidistant

int.name: inverse_rhotor_m
int.description: Flux surface type with radial label is sqrt[Phi/pi/B0], Phi being toroidal flux, poloidal mode number as dim2, could be non-equidistant

int.name: irregular_rz_na
int.description: Irregular grid, thus give list of vertices in dim1(1:ndim1), dim2(1:ndim1) and then all fields are on values(1:ndim1,1)
